data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Each direction starts you facing forward. One way involves facing left and going diagonally. The other involves facing right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around turns around. To turn right, you first turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you have taken 4 steps. If you walk back 6 steps, you have taken 4 steps. Taking 10 steps is the same as taking 3 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left. There are 2 ways to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps to turn around. Take 3 steps for 3 seconds. Turn around 2 more times and take the same steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn a 90 degree circle in one direction and back out. There are 7 steps and you don t turn around and back. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left and take the 4th step while you are in the driveway. Take all 4 steps while you are in the driveway to return to where you began. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 2 steps you return to the starting point after turning around for 4 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After facing forward, take the same number of steps to get towards the starting point and return

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A turn around is complete once you have taken 9 steps. If one takes 3 steps, one does not take the next 2 steps. If one takes 2 steps, they take the next 7 steps. So, this is the final answer: No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Rewinding one step only takes a step backward. You do not always reverse backward toward starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You must always face forward. After you have taken those steps, the last thing you want to do is start a new sequence. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 9 steps left and take 10 steps left. Take 1 step left and make 3 steps forward. Take 9 steps left and make 3 steps forward. Take 8 steps to the left. Take 8 steps left making 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps forward in the correct sequence. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point represents a path facing forward, and the correct way back is always to face the back. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The steps take one step right and another step forward. The beginning point is facing forward. One can only take 3 steps right and the starting point has to face away from the direction of travel. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and turn around again. Take 4 steps to turn around. Take 10 steps to take 8 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can take the same number of steps to get back to the starting point multiple times. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow these instructions you could turn around right and bring the vehicle to the same place. So, the answer is Yes.

It took 20 steps to get to the starting point. You can't turn back around while doing another round. Thus, the answer is No.

Turn right and take 1 step and then go one step and then turn right. You’ ll have a total of 7 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Turn left. Take 6 steps. Take 2 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps Return to starting point. So, the answer is No.

The one way to make a circle is to take 1 circle around a point and then take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are taking three steps, you begin by taking 3 steps. If you are taking seven steps, you start by taking 7 steps. If you are taking 10 steps, you begin by taking 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You must always face forward to complete the instructions. You add 6-8 steps left when taking 2 steps right and only take 3 steps right when walking backward and doing 5 steps in each direction. There are no steps backward while walking forward and taking 5 steps backward. To finish the instructions, you must take 9 steps forward and 7 steps straight. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can never go backwards in gravity. Once you go backwards, you're back to the starting place. So, the answer is no.

If you turn around, you are going to be walking back up to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

This is another way of saying, you always face forward, and you would take steps opposite. So, the answer is No.

You turn right at the beginning point and then take 5 steps to make it to the opposite side of the trail. Since there is no turning back, you just have to turn around. So, the answer is no.

Let’ s find the first step to every row in the correct order: Forward Step 1 Forward Step 2 Forward Step 3 Forward Step 8 Forward Step 5 Forward Step 6. So, the answer is Yes.

Just because you take 4 steps, does not mean it is one long step when one takes 1 step. So, the answer is Yes.

A person should turn around at one point. Just taking 9 steps makes you a roundabout. So, the answer is Yes.

Take one step back and 2 steps back. Take 6 steps back and take 6 steps back. So, the answer is No.

There are 4 steps right in this set of instructions and 1 step backwards, making the set a backward and forward sequence. A complete set of directions should always move you in the direction in which you are facing forward. So, the answer is No.

The one with 6 steps backwards can never get to where they started. The one with 14 steps backwards can never become to where they began. If you never face forward, you cannot make the one with 14 steps backwards return to where they started. This is because while facing forward, only one of the pairs of feet must be facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

One must always always face forward, or one cannot return to the starting point. To take 6 steps right, you start at the starting point. To take 9 steps left, you start at the starting point. If you always face forward and move forward, the point you start in is forward. If you always face left and move right, the point you start in is left. If you always face right, the point you start in is right. So, the answer is No.

If you take 7 steps backward in the second scenario, your step has been taken by 8 steps backward. If you take 7 steps backward in the first scenario, your step has been taken by 10 steps forward, so in the second scenario, your step has been taken by 10 steps forward. If you take 7 steps in the first scenario, your step has been taken by 7 steps right. If you have taken 7 steps in the first scenario, your step has been taken by 7 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.
